children.text: Introduction
This policy has been prepared to ensure that parents and prospective parents are aware of, and understand, the methods by which fees are to be paid.
To inform parents when the pricing structures are reviewed and when any increase to fees is likely to be applied.
This policy also adheres to the standards regulated by Kent and Surrey County Council regarding the Government Funding for 2, 3 and 4 year olds.
Policy
Registration Fees
Registration forms should be submitted one week before your child/ren attend the settings.
Sessions Fees

Fees will be charged monthly usually on or around the 26th of the month, and payment should be made before or on the 30th of the month. Payments are accepted by BACS, or childcare vouchers.No cash payments will be accepted. If you require a receipt of payment you will need to contact Margaret Hansen at wellybootsinfo@gmail.com.

For parents who have government funding, the invoice will show those sessions where funding has been claimed. Those children who attend over the 15 hours of government funding per week, will be charged for those sessions not funded. Parents who have children who access the funded sessions will be expected to complete a parental contract and this will be updated and require a signature at each funding block. Dates of funding blocks will be communicated in the form of a calendar on ClassDojo.
Those who are in receipt of Gov funding will be asked to make payment for consumables.
Wellyboots is a private family-owned company that relies on prompt payment of fees.
Accounts are required to be settled in full by the 30th of that month, failure to make payments on time may result in places being withdrawn. We will a late payment charge of £2 pr day of lateness
We value partnership working and if at any time a parent or carer experiences financial difficulty they must discuss with Kelly Pagethe company director who may consider an alternative payment plan.
Options

In the first instance, contact for outstanding fees will be made verbally or a telephone or copy invoice will be sent in the post. If after one-week failure to respond to this will result in written correspondence, either by letter or email.

Should no response be received to any of the above, one week after written correspondence, Kelly Page will consider whether any legal action will be taken to recover the debt or exclusion from the setting. Confidentiality of all parties at this time will be considered.
Absence
Fees remain chargeable in full when a child is absent through sickness or holiday or self-isolating.
Late Collection
Continuous late collection will incur a charge of £6 for the first 15 minutes per child, and a further £5 for every 5 minutes following.
Review of Fees
Fees are reviewed annually and parents will be notified within 30 days of any planned changes in writing.
Closure
Roodlands Farm setting will be closed between Christmas Eve and the day after New Year’s Day.
Wellyboots Pre-schools Mark Beech and Four Elms will be open term time only in line with Kent county council funding calendar (this can be viewed on ClassDojo).
All after school clubs will fall in line with the schools they serve, this will mean that should the school be closed then Wellyboots will be closed, and no charge will be made to you.
Schedule of Charges
Sessions Times Prices Per Session
Breakfast Club 7.30 am to 8.30 am £6 per hour Crockham Hill
AM
Pre-School Session 9.00 am to 12.00 pm £6 per hour 3-4 year Funded space £2 per hour
FEE funded space £1 per hour
PM
Pre-School Session 12.00 pm to 3.00 pm £6.00 per hour Funded Space £2 per hour
Late Afternoon Session/Afterschool Club 3.00 pm to 6.00 pm £6 per hour additional £1 per meal
Holiday care will be charged at £6 per hour
